PALAKKAD

Palakkad

is a district in the south-western part of Kerala that offers a variety of attractions for tourists. It is known for its natural beauty, historical heritage, and cultural diversity. Here are some of the highlights of Palakkad that you can explore:/p>

Palakkad Fort

This is one of the best-preserved forts in Kerala, built by Hyder Ali, the ruler of Mysore, in 1766. It is also known as Tipu Sultan Fort, after his son who captured it later. The fort has a hexagonal shape, with bastions, ramparts, and a moat. It also has a temple, a mosque, a jail, and a museum inside. The fort is a protected monument and a popular tourist attraction

Malampuzha Dam and Garden

This is a major irrigation project and a scenic spot in Palakkad district. The dam is built across the Malampuzha River, a tributary of the Bharathapuzha River, and forms a large reservoir. The garden is a beautiful and well-maintained park, with a variety of flowers, plants, and trees. The garden also has a rock garden, a sculpture garden, a fish-shaped aquarium, a snake park, a ropeway, and a toy train. The dam and the garden are ideal places for boating, fishing, and picnicking

Nelliyampathy Hills

This is a hill station and a biodiversity hotspot in Palakkad district. It is located at an altitude of 467 to 1572 meters above sea level, and offers a splendid view of the Palakkad valley and the Western Ghats. The hills are covered with tea, coffee, and spice plantations, and have a variety of flora and fauna. You can trek, camp, or visit the wildlife sanctuaries and national parks in the hills. Some of the popular attractions are the Seethargundu Viewpoint, the Pothundi Dam, the Kesavanpara Rock, and the Rajas Cliff

Kava

This is a picturesque and peaceful place in Palakkad district, near the Malampuzha Dam. It is a lower dam area, where you can enjoy the view of the water and the greenery. You can also walk on the hanging bridge that connects the island to the mainland, or take a bamboo raft ride on the river. Kava is a perfect place for nature lovers and photographers
